alert.note: Alert for Borden; Glasscock; Howard; Martin; Midland; Mitchell; Reagan; Scurry (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Midland-Odessa (Western Texas and Southeastern New Mexico)
info.headline: Dust Advisory issued March 14 at 4:43PM CDT until March 14 at 6:15PM CDT by NWS Midland-Odessa
info.description: The National Weather Service in Midland has issued a * Dust Advisory for... Glasscock County in western Texas... Scurry County in western Texas... Mitchell County in western Texas... Midland County in western Texas... Northern Reagan County in western Texas... Borden County in western Texas... Howard County in western Texas... Southeastern Martin County in western Texas... * Until 615 PM CDT. * At 442 PM CDT, a wall of dust was along a line extending from near Fluvanna to 9 miles northwest of Luther to 8 miles northwest of Midland, moving southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Less than two miles visibility, locally less than 1 mile visibility, with strong wind in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Doppler radar. IMPACT...Hazardous travel. * This includes Interstate 20 between mile markers 132 and 228. Locations impacted include... Midland, Big Spring, Snyder, Colorado City, Ackerly, Greenwood, Garden City, Gail, Stanton, Coahoma, Loraine, Forsan, Sand Springs, Lomax, Lenorah, Lake Colorado City, Lake Colorado City State Park, Inadale, Luther and Fluvanna. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Blowing dust brings reduced visibility, leading to dangerous driving conditions. If driving, avoid blowing dust if possible. If caught in dense blowing dust, pull off the road, turn off your lights and keep your foot off the brake.

area.areaDesc: Borden; Glasscock; Howard; Martin; Midland; Mitchell; Reagan; Scurry
